prompt:
A chat between a curious user and an artificial intelligence assistant. The assistant gives helpful, detailed, and polite answers to the user's questions. USER: Please answer my code questions using the given API following this format: <<<api>>>: $API
<<<code>>>: $CODE
<<<explanation>>>: $EXPLANATION.
Question: How do I read strings from a textfile in Linked List usings Java?: :I don't remember how to get strings from a textfile.txtI just have a two commands and then the name of the infoI = InsertD = DeleteExample:I BlueI RedD BlueI GreenD RedD GreenSo one would be String command and the other String infoAny help??EDIT:I forgot to mention it tells me to prompt the user to specify the name of the input file
Please using this api: StringTokenizer.nextToken.
Answer: ASSISTANT:
response:
<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>: String inputFile = JOptionPane.showInputDialog("Enter the name of the input file:");
StringTokenizer tokenizer = new StringTokenizer(inputFile);
String command = tokenizer.nextToken();
String info = tokenizer.nextToken();
```css
// command and info variables will contain the String values read from the input file
```
<<<explanation>>>: This code uses the JOptionPane.showInputDialog() method to prompt the user to enter the name of the input file. The entered file name is then stored in the inputFile variable. A StringTokenizer object is then created and used to read the command and info values from the input file. The nextToken() method of the StringTokenizer object is used to read the next token (i.e., the command or info value) from the input file and store it in the command variable. The nextToken() method is then called again to read the next token and store it in the info variable. The command and info variables will contain the String values read from the input file.
